metadata.title: CVE-2024-43842 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:wifi: rtw89: Fix array index mistake in rtw89_sta_info_get_iter()In rtw89_sta_info_get_iter() 'status->he_gi' is compared to array size.But then 'rate->he_gi' is used as array index instead of 'status->he_gi'.This can lead to go beyond array boundaries in case of 'rate->he_gi' isnot equal to 'status->he_gi' and is bigger than array size. Looks like"copy-paste" mistake.Fix this mistake by replacing 'rate->he_gi' with 'status->he_gi'.Found by Linux Verification Center (linuxtesting.org) with SVACE.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-43842` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
No subscription required

linux-image-4.8.0-39-generic - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
linux-image-4.8.0-39-generic-lpae - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
linux-image-4.8.0-39-lowlatency - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.8.0-39-generic - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1007-kvm - 4.4.0-1007.12
No subscription required

linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1031-aws - 4.15.0-1031.33~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.11.0-1015-azure - 4.11.0-1015.15
linux-image-extra-4.11.0-1015-azure - 4.11.0-1015.15
No subscription required
